column2: An analysis of changes in the average age of users of each drug over time included all 10
of the original ADAM II sites from 2000-2011 and added data from the five 2012 sites.
These analyses showed that cocaine and methamphetamine users are an aging
population in many of the 10 sites. Opiates presented a different picture with an
increasing proportion of younger users in some sites (Indianapolis, Minneapolis,
Portland) and a stable or aging group in others.
